column5: Hello there.&Um... is Welkin in?

column5: I work at the bakery. Well, I did until the&war started anyway. It's where I live, too.

column5: That's preserved bread, so it's pretty hard.&Heat it up before you eat it, all right?

column5: Thanks.&Uh, do you want to come in?

column5: Arrested AND shot at? Hah.&You've had a busy day of it, haven't you Welkies?

column5: What?

column5: That's a lovely portrait.&Is that General Gunther?

column5: Yup.&It was taken before I was born, but that's Dad.

column5: And who's that with him there?

column5: My father, Theimer. He was an engineer.&The General's tank was his creation.

column5: Wait a minute.&But I thought the general was your dad.

column5: My birth parents died when I was a baby.

column5: The general was kind enough to take me in&as his own after that.
column6: Le g<n<ral a eu la gentillesse de me prendre&comme si j'etais sienne apr>s cela.

column5: Yeah. We're not related by blood,&but she's definitely my little sister.

column5: Sorry. Was that question too personal?
column6: D<sol<. Cette question <tait-elle trop personnelle ?

column5: No, I don't mind at all.&I was blessed with two wonderful fathers.

column5: Yeah... I guess you were, huh?

column5: Oh, is that really the time?&I've got to get going.

column5: Why don't you see her off, Welks?&I can take care of the rest of this on my own.

column5: All right, I will.&I'll be right back.

column5: See you later Isara.&Safe travels!

column5: Wow, look at this.&Bruhl's really becoming a ghost town.

column5: They've been leaving for awhile.
column6: Ils ont commen< = partir depuis quelque temps.

column5: Just about everyone is evacuated by now.

column5: We'll survive. The town watch will guard and protect&the homefront. Everyone will come back someday.

column5: Mm-hmm.
column6: Mm-hmm.

column5: So Welkin, I'm curious,&are you going to join the army like your father?
column6: Donc Welkin, je suis curieuse, vas tu rejoindre l'arm<e&comme ton p>re?

column6: Mais, c'est juste que je... Je veux $tre utile, = ma facon.&Mon propre chemin, tu vois ce que je veux dire ?
